member.remarks: These states should also be in the set of all states.

member.name: M:System.Automata.MultitapeTuringMachine.Run(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Char})
member.param: The input to run the machine on.
member.returns: True if the machine halts in the accept state.
member.remarks: The first move the machine makes is to fill the first tape (tape 0) with the blank symbol followed by the input.

member.summary: Add a transition to the function
member.exception: If a transition has a null state
If a null transition (using EmptyString) was added

member.returns: A string of the form e(x0)Î”e(x1)Î”..Î”e(xk)Î” where e(xk) is the binary encoding of a single character.

member.name: M:System.Automata.TuringMachine.BinEncode(System.Automata.TuringMachine,System.Char[])
member.returns: A string âˆˆ {0, 1, Î”}* representing a turing machine in the form Î”e(m0)Î”e(m1)Î”..Î”e(mk)Î”e(x) Where mk is a transition and e is the binary encoding function.
member.remarks: See BinEncode(TuringTransition) and BinEncode(char[]) for specific encodings.

member.name: M:System.Automata.TuringMachine.BinEncode(System.Automata.TuringTransition,System.Automata.States)
member.returns: A string âˆˆ {0, 1, Î”}* representing a turing transition ð›¿(p, Ïƒ) = (q, Ï„, D) where p,q âˆˆ S, Ïƒ,Ï„ âˆˆ Î£ in the form n(indexof(p))Î”n(Ïƒ)Î”n(indexof(q))Î”n(Ï„)Î”n(D)Î” where n(x) reperesents the binary integer or UTF representation of x. n(D) = { L->00, R->01, S->10, err->11 }
member.exception: If a state referenced is not contained in s
